talk0021:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Thank you! Before you go, I'll add an
extra little bit of love to it...
talk0024:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Greeting_01>So I started making garlands that look
like the <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff>, hoping they'd bring
people together even more.
I want them to make lots of people happy,
so I'm only charging a little bit.

That's right—only <clr:0000>five rupees <clr:ffff>each. Well?
talk_01: <sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Wakeup>*yawn* I have to wake up Cottla...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk0025:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseS>Whaaat?<sp:5:0:0> You're an adult, and you don't
even have <clr:0000>five rupees<clr:ffff>?

<sp:3:0:2:0300><clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000>How will I make lots of people happy if these are
too expensive?<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>
talk0026:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>After the <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff> fell from the sky,
<clr:0000>Kakariko Village <clr:ffff>got much busier.

It's like we're more a part of everyone's
lives now, and they're more a part of
our village!
talk_04: <sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0500>Maybe we can have family time today... <sp:5:1:0>Huh?<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk0028:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I'm sorry, but I can make only so many
ring garlands.

I'll sell you one each day. I hope you
really like them though!
talk0029:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>How about a <clr:0000>ring garland <clr:ffff>as a souvenir?
Only <clr:0000>five rupees<clr:ffff> each!
talk0040:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>Are you, um, going to take your <clr:0000>ring
garland<clr:ffff>? I've been watching it for you,
but it's really late...
talk_06:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Cottla, Father is busy with work today, so
the two of us will talk to Mother together!
talk0041:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseM_00>Umm... <sp:5:0:0>That spot is reserved for my
ring garlands!
talk_07:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:Tired_00>Sorry, I'm in a hurry. Mother is waiting,
so please excuse me.
talk0042:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:Notice>You already have it, silly. Don't forget to
take it with you!
talk0043:
<sp:3:0:2:0200><snd:Angry_00>Get down from there! You're gonna get it
all dirty!
talk_09:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad>I've used up every scrap of energy
working hard. Time to get some sleep
so I can work hard again tomorrow...
talk_20:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:Tired_00>Eek, the ring garlands will get wet!
Please come back later!
talk0044:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>I don't like to take this tone with
customers, but you're an adult. You
should know manners better than that.
talk_21:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:TalkPositive>Mother used to say that people who
spend lots of time in the rain are trying
to hide something.
What are you trying to hide? Your
footsteps? Or maybe...your tears?

<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS>Just kidding! It's a joke!


<sp:3:0:2:0701>For some reason, Koko always—I mean,
I always feel sad on rainy days.
talk_22:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><clr:0200><sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Angry_00>Yesss!<clr:ffff><sp:0:2:2:6400>


All right. Will you please follow Kok—
I mean, follow me?
talk0046:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>You look like an adult, but you act like
more of a kid than I do. <sp:5:1:0>Even my little
sister, Cottla, is more mature than that.
ReturnHome_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0400>Oh, are you maybe here to buy a
ring garland?

<sp:3:0:2:0300>Sorry, but I don't sell them at night.<sp:5:0:0>
Come to our shop in the daytime!
talk_First_talk_03:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Angry_00><sp:0:2:2:5000><clr:0200>Yesss!<clr:ffff><sp:0:2:2:6400>


You're in luck! I'm selling my very
super-special ring garlands.

I make them to look like the Ring Ruins.
Maybe they'll bring people together like
never before. Like the ruins here have!
I've opened my shop under the tree in
front of the chief's house. We aren't open
all the time, so keep an eye out!
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_00>You'll know you're in the right place
when you see the adorable shopkeeper.
Tee-hee!
talk_23:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Is everything all right? Oh, I know what's
bothering you.

You're looking for a souvenir to mark your
visit to the Ring Ruins, aren't you?
talk_First_talk_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Oh... I see. Even though you came aaall
the way to town?

If you change your mind, try the shop by
the chief's house. It isn't open all the
time, but it has the best souvenirs!
talk_24:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:TalkPositive>Rain might be good for hiding tears, but
you shouldn't need to hide. Let tears
flow. Use rain for hiding other things.
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Just kidding! About hiding things, I mean.
It's important not to feel ashamed of
your tears.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>You know, for some reason, I always feel
sad on rainy days.
talk0048:
<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseL>Auuugh! <sp:5:1:0>Fire!<sp:0:2:2:6400>


What have you done?! <sp:5:1:0>We have to put
that out right away!<sp:5:1:0>
talk_25:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0700>Mother... I'm sorry I don't come to visit more often.


It's because Paya—I mean, the chief—is hard at work
under the <clr:0000>Ring Ruin <clr:ffff>closest to your grave.

Wait a little longer, OK?<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk0019:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>You should mark your visit to the Ring
Ruins and Kakariko Village!

How about a <clr:0000>ring garland<clr:ffff>? They're made
with lots of love, and they're only <clr:0000>five
rupees<clr:ffff> each!
talk0030:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Excuse me! I made this <clr:0000>ring garland<clr:ffff>,
and it only costs <clr:0000>five rupees<clr:ffff>.

Please pay me if you want one!
talk0031:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I made this <clr:0000>ring garland<clr:ffff>, and it only
costs <clr:0000>five rupees<clr:ffff>.

You mustn't take one unless you've paid
for it!
Talk_Greeting_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Welcome to <clr:0000>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff>! I'm happy
you made it even in the rain.
talk0034:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>Bye! I hope you have all sorts of good
things ahead of you!
talk_13: <sp:3:0:2:0700>Cottla, it's time to pray to Mother!
talk0037:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>All right, I hope you have a lot of people
in your day too!
talk_14:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Are you looking for a souvenir to mark
your visit to the Ring Ruins?
talk0039:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>You almost walked off without your <clr:0000>ring
garland<clr:ffff>, silly!
talk0051:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>Looks like you really enjoy <clr:0000>ring garlands<clr:ffff>!
Now, I hope you have all sorts of good
things ahead of you!
talk_17:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0700>Mother... Cottla, Father, and I are all well.


It's a little lonely now that Father works for the chief,
though. He doesn't come home much anymore.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk_18:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0700>Mother... I'm sorry I don't come to visit more often.


I want to, but <clr:0000>Princess Zelda <clr:ffff>said we mustn't go
near the <clr:0000>Ring Ruin <clr:ffff>closest to your grave. I don't
know why.
Paya—I mean, the chief—doesn't know either.
She says she's worried.

It must be hard to be an adult, huh?<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk_19:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0700>Mother... Cottla, Father, and I are all well.


The path to your grave was blocked for a while, but
Paya—she's the chief now—said we can go through.

We can visit you properly from now on!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk0020:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>They're decorations I made using flowers
and plants and things.
